intro: Hedysarum brotherusi, commonly known as the Brotherus' vetch, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters. The plant features compound leaves with three to five leaflets and produces small, yellowish-white flowers in clusters. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is known for its ability to fix nitrogen in the soil. Hedysarum brotherusi is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats and is adapted to harsh, arid environments.
